text.p: Following is a summary of expected new issues in the international primary debt market.
The list was compiled from information provided by borrowers, banks mandated to lead manage the issues and other primary market sources. All terms and conditions are indicative.
For emerging market borrowers see Eurobonds - Expected emerging market new issues'.
Details of upcoming bond issues can be telephoned into the London newsroom on +44 171 542 8863
(OFFICIAL indicates confirmed by borrower)
* * * DOLLARS * * *
+ ASIAN DEVELOPMENT BANK, eyeing $1.0 bln 10-year bond
+ BGB FINANCE, eyeing $500 million five-year bond, +20 bp
+ NATIONAL BANK OF GREECE, $200 million subordinated 10-year FRN
via Chase, five-year call (OFFICIAL)
+ SWEDEN, $500 million seven-year bond mooted
+ TMCC, 10-year dollar bond via Merrill Lynch
+ WACHOVIA BANK, $300 million five-year FRN, Merrill, week of May 12
+ WORLD BANK, CANADA, CANADIAN PROVINCES eyeing 10-year dollars
+ XEROX, up to $250 million at three to five years
* * * DUTCH GUILDERS * * *
+ AUSTRIA, eyeing sector
+ KREDITANSTALT FUER WEIDERAUFBAU eyeing sector
* * * FRENCH FRANCS * * *
+ FANNIE MAE global bond issue in French francs possible
+ FINLAND, eyeing a deal in French francs for May/June
+ ITALY, debut French franc bond, up to 7.0 billion FFR
+ KREDITANSTALT FUER WEIDERAUFBAU eyeing sector
+ LVMH, said to be eyeing sector
+ RHEINHYP, 1.5-2.0 billion French francs (OFFICIAL)
* * * LIRE * * *
+ BENNETTON GROUP, 500 billion lire worth of bonds
+ FANNIE MAE, considering global bond in lire
* * * MARKS * * *
+ DRESDNER BANK, 1.5 billion mark warrant bond, mid-April,
via Dresdner Finance (OFFICIAL)
+ GERMAN LANDER, said to be planning third Lander jumbo deal
+ IMPRESS METAL PACKAGING, 200 million mark high-yield bond,
Salomon/UBS, May
+ ITALY, up to 1.0 billion marks at five- or seven-years
* * * STERLING * * *
+ German banks eyeing sector
+ BICC Plc, 10-year bond, HSBC and SBC Warburg
+ CASTLE TRANSMISSION SERVICES, 100 million stg junk bond, CSFB/JPM
+ SUTTON BRIDGE POWER, owned by Enron Corp, eyeing sector
* * * SWISS FRANCS * * *
+ TOKYO ELECTRIC POWER, eyeing sector
+ AFRICAN DEVELOPMENT BANK, eyeing sector
* * * ASSET-BACKED/STRUCTURED * * *
+ AT&T UNIVERSAL CARDS, $1.0 billion asset-backed bond
+ BRITANNIA BUILDING SOCIETY, mortgage-backed bond.
+ CITIBANK, DEAN WITTER, securitised mark bonds
+ FIRST CHICAGO, self-led 7 or 10-yr asset-backed global FRN
+ MORGAN STANLEY, said to be preparing a 1.0 bln lire
securitisation of a pool of mortgages the bank bought from
Istituto Bancario San Paolo di Torino and a sterling deal of
up to 200 million stg to finance the M6 road.
+ NORWEST FINANCIAL, $1.0 billion auto-loan backed issue via
Lehamn Brothers.
+ ORCHID SECURITIES, $400 million asset-backed FRN,Merrill Lynch
+ SPV RESIDENTIAL REINSURANCE LTD, $500 million, Merrill
Lynch, first public bond whose principal payments
dependent on losses incurred by insurance group USAA.
